description: A rugged undeveloped coastline hammered eternally by the open Pacific. Settled by Danish immigrants in 1897 and later abandoned, the mist has reclaimed these lands. Wolf, bear and cougar live amongst these beaches and trees now. Elusive guardians, waiting, watching.
directions:
The 45km extension to the Cape Scott trail network was officially opened in 2008.
NOTE: (trailpeak editor), this is a stub, for those with more information on this trail, please use our wiki edit (above) and add segment notes, start and finish notes, transportation notes and images.
title: North Coast Trail
